etymology.description: 通心 (through-core; hollow-core) + 菜 (vegetable) = hollow-core vegetable → water spinach.
etymology.interpretation: Named for its hollow, tubular stems: “through-core vegetable.” Often used interchangeably with 空心菜 in Mandarin and related to Cantonese 通菜.

parts.english: through the core; hollow-core; tubular; open-passage

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃清炒通心菜(我喜歡吃清炒通心菜)。
examples.english: I like to eat stir-fried water spinach.

examples.chinese: 通心菜的茎是空心的(通心菜的莖是空心的)。
examples.pinyin: Tōngxīncài de jīng shì kōngxīn de.
examples.english: The stems of water spinach are hollow.

examples.chinese: 今天市场有新鲜的通心菜(今天市場有新鮮的通心菜)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān shìchǎng yǒu xīnxiān de tōngxīncài.
examples.english: The market has fresh water spinach today.
